intro: Hiptage ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty hiptage, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmately lobed leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers with red veins. It typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Hiptage ferruginea is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and stream banks.
